alert.note: Alert for Choctaw (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 4:58PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Choctaw and northeastern Wayne Counties through 600 PM CDT... At 457 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 10 miles north of Waynesboro, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Silas and Gilbertown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
